text.text_translated: Earthquakes damage all kinds of buildings, including bridges. Luckily, bridges do not fall down very often, especially modern ones. Engineers have learned to build bridges in earthquake areas on ground that is stronger and moves less during an earthquake.

feedback.feedback: PASS. The feedback is direct, blunt, and concise. It correctly identifies the specific sentence causing the failure ('Engineers have learned...') and provides a clear, quantifiable reason (21 words > 15 words), making the feedback actionable and well-justified.
